reviewText: My experience w/ TROMA has been hit and miss. With LUTHER THE GEEK, TROMA has struck pure, gooshy gold! LUTHER is a straight-ahead, maniac-on-the-loose movie w/ a wonderful lunatic (Edward Terry) that has been traumatized into acting / clucking like a chicken. As absurd as this may sound, it actually works! The plot, about LUTHER's (unwise) release from prison, and his subsequent assault on a rural family, is pulled off w/ genuinely disturbing style and insane glee! While I highly recommend LTG to all gorehundts, I also recommend it for those looking for an original, interesting horror film...
Title: N/A

reviewText: An odd movie about a deranged "geek"(not a nerd,but a REAL geek-one who bites heads off chickens)paroled from prison on a murder charge to resume his mayhem.He sets his sights on a remote farm-house and all heck breaks loose!After a silly intro the flick slips into a cool suspenseful groove.TROMA put out this dvd and has all the usual TROMA stuff as well as some good Luther extras with extended and/or deleted scenes,drector(with cute dog)interview,and other suff.Check it out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Low budget horror about a killer that acts like a chicken and gets paroled even though he acts like a chicken!Sounds about right!I probally would have only given 3 stars,but this dvd from troma is packed with hours of extras.I can't say I have ever seen a horror movie with a killer of this sort(Props for the originality).Yeah... it's moronic ,but that just makes it funny as hell.When you see this guy going around making chicken noises it's hard not to laugh.I gather that is the effect they were going for and it works on that level.The gore effects are done well and the acting as good as can be for a z-grade movie.A great pick up for the cult classic lover.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is obviously influenced by THE TEXAS CHAINSAW MASSACRE.  It was made in 1990 but feels like an 80s film.  There's no chainsaw killer in this film, but the fans of that classic will notice that it was an influence here.  The killer doesn't hide in the shadows like in other 80s slasher flicks; he's shown throughout the film.  It's about a kid called Luther who joins an angry torch wielding mod to harass a circus geek who bites the heads off chickens.  The kid starts to get in the way, and then one of those people pushes him aside; and then he falls down and knocks out some of his teeth.  When he grows up, he's incarcerated for murder.  However, he's then paroled.  He makes himself a metal mouthpiece and travels to a countryside house where he begins chomping on whoever comes by.  The body count in the film is low, but the violence is brutal and graphic.  Unlike many other slashers from the 80s, the violence is more disturbing than fun.  There's also a gratuitous shower scene, and the films pace is pretty fast.  The film is intense, and I thought the replay value was really good.This DVD is obviously mastered from a VHS master tape.  The colors look washed out but overall the quality was decent. Extras include the extended Stacy Haiduk shower scene outtakes.  You get to see a lengthy scene with more explicit shots.  The quality on the shower scene outtakes is soft, but the color and contrast are better than what's shown in the film.
summary: One of the lesser known slashers
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film is out there. You will never see anything like this again. Mind you this is not a Troma original, they just got the rights to release it. Edward Terry's performance of Luther is spectacular considering he doesnt say one word in the film. He just clucks like a chicken. The ending isnt too shocking, its actually pretty funny. The gore when shown is pretty good. The action was so-so. The young daughter in the film has very nice breasts and they are shown here lovingly(also as an extra check out the extended shower scene). For the price of this dvd you cant beat it. It comes with interviews(the director), deleted scenes, an intro by Loyd Kaufman who is very zany but entertaining. Plus there are other bonus's like real-life freaks and for some odd reason two short videos on how animals are slaughtered and why you should be vegan. Obviously Troma support Veganism, and I do agree and see their point, but why is this on the "Luther The Geek" dvd? Its a very cruel, sad video. Overall a good addition to a horror movie fan's collection.
summary: Luther The Geek gets the loaded DVD treatment
Title: N/A

reviewText: A man named Luther once had a bad childhood when he witnessed a real freak eating live chicken heads and he grows up to become a maniac that talks like a Chicken and has razor-sharp metal dentures that can rip people's flesh apart. After murdering an old lady outside of a grocery store, he stowaway's in a woman's car and takes her hostage inside of a farmhouse as her daughter must try to save her including her boyfriend.Violent and maniacal low budget horror thriller that works on many levels with an interesting and original storyline. The acting is kinda bad but hey! what B-movie doesn't? Director Cartlon J. Albright ("The Children") has succeeded in making a cult favorite that has been re-issued by Troma.This DVD contains fair picture and sound with extras like introduction by Troma creator Lloyd Kaufman, interview with the director, Troma TV clip, Troma Trailers, "Make Your Own Damn Movie" in a Box ad and Radioation March short.Also recommended: "The Hills Have Eyes (1977 and 2006)", "Mother's Day", "Sleepaway Camp", "Cannibal Apocalypse", "The Untold Story", "Silence of The Lambs", "Hostel 1 & 2", "House of 1000 Corpses", "The Devil's Rejects", "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre series including 2003 remake and The Beginning", "The Toxic Avenger", "Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer", "Last House on The Left", "Maniac (1980)", "I Spit on Your Grave", "The Toolbox Murders (1978 and 2004)", "Scream", "Terror Firmer", "Intruder", "High Tension", "Wolf Creek", "Rabid Grannies", "Psycho (1960)", "Jeepers Creepers 1 & 2", "House on The Edge of the Park", "The Bird with the Crystal Plumage", "Cannibal The Musical" and "The New York Ripper".
summary: A very interesting and dark indepenent horror flick.

reviewText: {DVD director's cut.}  Well, a poor movie at best.  Typical "victims" that are useless.  My 70 year old mother would have wasted Luther  right off the bat. Even an armed cop couldn't handle the freek. The only reason for getting this movie is Stacy Haiduk's nude scenes.  I was hoping that the shower scene outakes would have shown more. Stacy is entwined with her co-star and we don't get to see her by herself.Fred Olen Ray needs to teach the director how to shoot a shower scene.  If he shot it, we would have seen her strip for the camera, shower with "no curtain", "then" the guy would have shown up. Also, the outakes are very grainy. Why is the movie clear and outakes grainy?  I was hoping for the lovemaking scene in the bed to have outakes too, but they didn't add them.  The other extra's are lame.

reviewText: Sorry for the ridiculous title but this crazy film deserves nothing less. "Luther the Geek" is a basic slasher movie containing a few things that truly set it apart from most. First, the actor who portrays Luther does an excellent job at portraying a seriously deranged psychotic. I don't know of too many actors who could pull off the fact that their only dialouge consists of squawking like a chicken, yet not make it seem funny. Second, a generally twisted feel overall that culminates in a very unsettling ending. The film also has a clausterphobic feel to it as most of the action takes place in or around an isolated farmhouse, somewhat in a "Texas Chainsaw Massacre" mold. The gore effects are generally good with the vomiting blood scene being the most shocking. "Luther the Geek" is simply a disturbing movie that is one of my guilty pleasures, check it out. One note, since Troma acquired this, they have tacked on a rather obscene prolouge with Lloyd Kaufman introducing the film. Normally his stuff is kind of funny, this one is just tasteless.
Title: N/A
